intro: Polygala vulgaris subsp. comosa, commonly known as the common milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
